Title: Travel Center General Manager
Section_0:
Pilot Flying J is seeking an experienced Retail General Manager to oversee our high-volume retail facilities. You will be responsible for the generation and execution of travel center and restaurant business plans to achieve established standards, sales and profit objectives as well as customer satisfaction.

The Retail General Manager will also be
Section_1: Ensuring that customer expectations are metConducting meetings with subordinate employeesMaintaining effective vendor relationships
Section_2: As a Retail General Manager for Pilot Flying J, you will build, coach, manage and develop teams from a staffing, interviewing, hiring and training standpoint.
Section_3: Additional responsibilities for the Retail General Manager include
Section_4: Driving salesManaging team membersTracking inventoryProviding customer servicePerforming PL analysis
Section_5: Pay Rates Starting between 67,800.00 - 98,360.00  year
Section_10: Fuel DiscountNation-wide Medical PlanDentalVision401(k)Flexible Spending AccountsAdoption AssistanceTuition ReimbursementFlexible ScheduleWeekly Pay
Section_6: As a Retail General Manager, you must exemplify integrity and accountability at the managerial level as well as demonstrate excellent team leadership skills. Furthermore, you must be able to work a flexible schedule of nights, days, weekends and holidays.
Section_8: Additional requirements of the Retail General Manager include
Section_9: Minimum 2-3 years of management experience in the retail, restaurant, grocery or other service industry with responsibility for financial resultsPrevious management proficiency in high volume retail with PL accountabilityAbility to create and maintain a customer focused culture

Title: Supervisor, Regional Facility Services
Section_0: The purpose of this job is to manage, lead, and direct regional maintenance technicians (RMTs) and oversee the completion of facility maintenance tasks.
Section_1: 1. Oversee, lead, and set priorities for RMTs
Section_2: 2. Select, coach, train, and develop direct reports, to include appraising job performance in conducting performance reviews
Section_3: 3. Communicate and execute company objectives provided by maintenance leadership
Section_4: 4. Review and analyze facility and environmental checklists for accuracy and completion provide coaching or direction for discrepancies
Section_5: 5. Create monthly RMT schedule ensure facilities have RMT coverage provide maintenance assistance or coverage where needed
Section_10: 10. Model behaviors that support the companys common purpose ensure guests and team members are supported at the highest level
Section_6: 6. Resolve escalated facility maintenance disputes and discrepancies
Section_8: 8. Respond to after-hours emergency dispatch requests
Section_9: 9. Provide and schedule on-site training for maintenance team members at new store openings and acquisitions
Section_11: 11. Ensure all activities are in compliance with rules, regulations, policies, and procedures
Section_13: High school diploma or equivalent certificate required trade or vocational school preferred Minimum five years experience in preventive maintenance requiredValid state drivers license requiredClass B environmental certifications required post hireMinimum five years experience managing others preferredIntermediate Microsoft Office skillsPrior experience with electrical, plumbing, and HVAC systemsBasic understanding of construction practicesAbility to lead, coach, and motivate team membersStrong analytical and problem solving skillsExcellent listening, written and verbal interpersonal communication skillsIntermediate mathematical skillsStrong attention to detailAbility to work in complex, fast-paced environmentAbility to navigate change and ambiguityAbility to multitaskAbility to collaborate with other team members and departmentsGeneral office work requiring sitting or standing for long periods of timeAble to lift up to 50 poundsWork with electric and fuel systemsExposure to various weather conditions and temperaturesAble to bend, stoop, twist, and crawlClimb laddersTravel required greater than 75%
Section_14: Medical, Dental,  Vision Insurance401kWeekly PayAdoption AssistanceTuition Reimbursement
Section_7: 7. Audit and approve expense reports, purchase cards, time sheets, GPS records, and work orders

Title: Area Facility Maintenance Technician
Section_0: Are you a jack of all trades? Do you enjoy working at multiple facilities across a large area? Do you have flexibility to travel to different areas weekly? This is the position for you!
Section_1: Inspect multiple facilities following a comprehensive facility maintenance assessments perform preventative maintenance repairsComplete maintenance work orders perform minor electrical, carpentry, and plumbing servicesCollaborate with general managers to review and resolve open maintenance issuesMaintain communication with dispatch report steps taken for work order resolutionRespond to corporate project requests and surveys resolve issues and report findings to supervisorsCommunicate with multiple teams and management on a weekly or monthly basis to ensure compliance and consistency regarding maintenance projectsAdvise managers of maintenance concerns and ensure creation of work order requestsUtilize various computer systems to track and report maintenance requestsParticipate in company sponsored safety training classesMaintain technical and product knowledge on all equipment within the technicians area of responsibilityModel behaviors that support the companys common purpose ensure guests and team members are supported at the highest levelEnsure all activities are in compliance with rules, regulations, policies, and procedures
Section_2: High school diploma or equivalent certificate requiredValid state drivers license requiredMinimum five years preventive maintenance experience requiredTrade or vocational school preferredPrior experience with electrical, plumbing, and HVAC systemsBasic understanding of construction practicesIntermediate mathematical skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to collaborate and work both on a team or independently with minimal supervisionStrong attention to detailClimb laddersLift up to 50 poundsWork with electric and fuel systemsExposure to inclement weatherAbility to bend, stoop, twist, crawlTravel required up to 85% varies by region
Section_3: Fuel DiscountNation-wide Medical PlanDentalVision401(k)Flexible Spending AccountsAdoption AssistanceTuition ReimbursementFlexible ScheduleWeekly Pay
